Talk_14:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I wanted to see with my own eyes what
I had previously only read of in books.

That was why I ceded my position as chief
and left with Cado.

Poor Paya. She was shocked to have
the mantle of leadership thrust upon her
so suddenly.
<sp:3:0:2:0500>But I knew that within her lay the seeds
of a capable chief.

All those seeds needed was a chance
to grow.

<sp:3:0:2:0800>Now Paya is firmly on her own path as the
leader of the village.

<sp:3:0:2:0801>To see my granddaughter learning to
<clr:0000>decipher the Zonai language<clr:ffff>... It is a
delight, if certainly not a surprise.
And it means that I can rest easy in
my retirement.
Talk_15:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>You have caught glimpses of Princess
Zelda's memories...

That certainly seems as though it must be
an omen of some kind.

<sp:3:0:2:0700>The village is now in Paya's hands
as chief, so I can pour over the
literature freely.
You ought to devote your efforts to
calming the effects of the Upheaval.
Talk_18:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:SurpriseL_00>Ah. I see that you are wearing the attire of
the ancient hero.

<sp:3:0:2:0100>How amusing. <sp:5:0:0>You almost look like that
figure depicted on the screen...
Talk_19:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_00>...But first, you should at least put a
shirt on.
Talk_20:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>And Link... We may be old friends, but I
still expect you to show respect in the
chief's hall.<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0200>Would you at least put a shirt on?
Talk_21:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>And Link... I will remind you this village
has a history with the Yiga Clan.<sp:5:1:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0200>So please, stop this tasteless prank, and
put something else on!
TerrorSword_01: The joke has gone too far!
Talk_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Greeting_00>Well, if it isn't Link. I am always pleased
to find you in good health.

I only just came back to the village myself.


<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I have been thinking of those glimpses
you had of the Light Dragon's—or rather,
Princess Zelda's—memories.
It seems as though that must be an omen
of some kind.

<sp:3:0:2:0700>The village is now in Paya's hands as
chief, so I intend to keep looking for a
way to restore the princess.
You ought to devote your efforts to
calming the effects of the Upheaval.
Talk_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Perhaps you recognize what is shown
on that screen.
Talk_03:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>That reminds me. Purah left a
journal here.

But where did I put it?


<sp:3:0:2:0000>She told me to hide the thing. Perhaps I
followed her instructions too well.

<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy_01>I managed to conceal it from myself.
TerrorFire_00: The joke has gone too far!
Talk_09:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Ah, Link. You chose a late hour to
drop by.
Talk_10:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Ah, Link. Isn't it raining outside?
And still you came.
Talk_11:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The Calamity was the Demon King of
ancient times, brought back to existence
in the form of hatred manifest.
Some of our youths believe the Calamity
to be mere legend. You and I know better,
of course.
Shown here are the royal princess with
the power to seal away evil...<sp:5:0:0>and a warrior
chosen by a legendary sword.
This image depicts how, using four
relics called Divine Beasts built by our
ancestors, they drove off the Calamity.
Talk_12:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>It is a part of our history which must never
be forgotten—the Calamity.
Talk_13:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy_01>That reminds me. Symin told me he is
teaching the children at <clr:0000>Hateno School<clr:ffff>
a <clr:0000>lesson about the Calamity<clr:ffff>.
The school is in <clr:0000>Hateno Village<clr:ffff> to the
<clr:0000>southeast<clr:ffff>, not far from here.

Why not drop by and take the
lesson yourself?
